text:
The Bowery, east side, north from East Houston Street to Cooper Union (extreme left) and showing an early view of this important thoroughfare prior to the construction of the Elevated Line. The Savings Bank appearing on the right and adjoining the N.E. corner of Houston Street is the Mechanics and Traders, No. 283 Bowery, according to Gouldings Business Directory of 1875. Rands New York City Business Directory of 1877 list: same as a National Bank with a location given as Ho. 153. The building bearing the flags is the Germania Assembly Rooms. North of the latter and occupying the S.E. and N.E. corners of East 1st Street are two low buildings; one with a hip roof. These remain today (1938) though the rest of the outline has disappeared. Note the 4 sets of rails in the road bed, several of which appear with horse drawn cars thereon.
1870.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Houston Street (East)

text:
The Bowery, north from East Houston Street, to Cooper Square.

This photo is a duplicate of a larger print included in this collection.

About 1890

Gift Thru The New York Historical Society
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Houston Street (East)

text:
Bowery, north from East Houston Street, to Cooper Square, showing the Third Ave. Elevated Line with a steam drawn train thereon. Streetcars at this date were horse drawn. Note on the left, Hartfield the Costumer, Callahan the Hatter and the Globe Museum.

About 1890.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Houston Street (East)

text:
(1)
Bowery, east side, north from East Houston Street. The view shows an empty lot at the N.E. corner. (A relic of the subway construction on East Houston Street, for a branch line of the Municipal Eighth Ave., Subway) utilized for a parking space. The stair approach to the East Houston Street Station of the Third Ave., Elevated is shown on the left. Against the skyline, in the background, is silhouetted the Empire State and the Metropolitan Life Insurance Buildings.

May 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same slightly northward.

March 13, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
Bowery, west side, north from but not including East Houston Street.
May 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Houston Street (East)
